hook.text: Your city needs a new bridge. It issues bonds to pay for it. You buy one and earn tax-free interest.

buildup.text: Municipal bonds fund public projects: schools, hospitals, highways. Interest is often exempt from federal taxes.

discovery.text: For high earners in the 37% tax bracket, a 3% muni bond equals about 4.8% from a taxable bond.

twist.text: Munis are not risk-free. Detroit defaulted on its bonds in 2013. Puerto Rico defaulted on $70 billion.

climax.text: Revenue bonds are backed by specific projects. If the toll road doesn't get traffic, bondholders suffer.

punchline.text: Munis offer tax-free income. Just make sure the city can actually pay you back.

quiz.question: What is the main tax advantage of municipal bonds?
options: Interest is often exempt from federal taxes
They have zero risk of default
They pay the highest yields available
